flow.descriptionCdata:
b0ed2fb7-cdf4-47df-9a82-5d2a6bb68967.22160c1e-3153-472e-b1f2-ef1a08aaa4c6.description=
Counts from one number to another number.

Inputs\:
from - The number to start counting at
to - The number to count to
incrementBy - The amount to increment by during each count.
reset - If set to true, then the counter will restart counting from the beginning.

Responses\:
has more - Not yet done counting.
failure - Something went wrong.
no more - Done counting. This will only be returned once, then counting restarts.

Returns\:
The number that was just counted.
b0ed2fb7-cdf4-47df-9a82-5d2a6bb68967.3b2bb3dd-b369-4fba-9ce3-e547f0dd4693.description=
Runs an SSH command

Inputs\:
host - Hostname or ip address.
port - The port number for running the command. It overwrites the port given inside the host input -in a syntax like host\:port-, if this exists.
command - The command to execute.
arguments - The arguments to pass to the command.
pty - Whether to use pty (true, false. Default is false).
privateKeyFile - Path to private key file, relative to ICONCLUDE_HOME on the RAS.
username - Username to connect as.
password - Password of user. If using a private key file this will be used as the passphrase for the file.
timeout - Time in milliseconds to wait for the command to complete (optional, default 90 seconds).
characterSet - The characterSet name for input stream encoding from the target machine. For example, SJIS, EUC-JP, UTF-8.  By default it is UTF-8. 
closeSession - Close SSH session at completion of this operation (true, false)? If false the ssh session will be cached for future calls of this operation during the life of the flow. If true the ssh session used by this operation will be closed. Default is true.

Responses\:
success - The command was executed successfully.
failure - The command could not be executed.

Extra Results\:
STDERR - The STDERR of the command.
STDOUT - The STDOUT of the command.
b0ed2fb7-cdf4-47df-9a82-5d2a6bb68967.3b2c0b3c-3dd3-48aa-999f-4e0d40bb8095.description=
Creates a SSH Shell session to be used by multiple SSH Shell operations.

Inputs\:
host - Hostname or ip address.
port - The port number for running the command. It overwrites the port given inside the host input -in a syntax like host\:port-, if this exists.
username - Username to connect as.
password - Password of user. If using a private key file this will be used as the passphrase for the file.
privateKeyFile - Private key to be used during ssh authentication, relative to ICONCLUDE_HOME on RAS host.

Responses\:
success - SSH shell session and sessionId successfully created.
failure - An error occured while attempting to create the ssh shell session.

Extra Results\:
sessionId\: The ssh session identifier to be used for SSH Shell and SSH Shell Logoff operations.  This session identifier can only be used in the flow run context that it is created in.  multiple ssh shell sessions can be created and distinquished by assigning this sessionId to unique flow variables.

privateKeyFile - Private key to be used during ssh authentication, relative to ICONCLUDE_HOME on RAS host.

b0ed2fb7-cdf4-47df-9a82-5d2a6bb68967.975d6552-09f2-4a8a-aff8-a7f6758c46ac.description=
Sleeps for "X" seconds.

Inputs\:
seconds - The number of seconds to sleep.

Responses\:
success - Slept for "X" seconds.
failure - was unable to sleep for some reason

b0ed2fb7-cdf4-47df-9a82-5d2a6bb68967.f4815ec0-abf4-48d2-a5a5-a936007c9ead.description=
Creates a SSH Shell session to be used by multiple SSH Shell operations.

Inputs\:
host - Hostname or ip address.
port - The port number for running the command. It overwrites the port given inside the host input -in a syntax like host\:port-, if this exists.
username - Username to connect as.
password - Password of user. If using a private key file this will be used as the passphrase for the file.
privateKeyFile - Private key to be used during ssh authentication, relative to ICONCLUDE_HOME on RAS host.

Responses\:
success - SSH shell session and sessionId successfully created.
failure - An error occured while attempting to create the ssh shell session.

Extra Results\:
sessionId\: The ssh session identifier to be used for SSH Shell and SSH Shell Logoff operations.  This session identifier can only be used in the flow run context that it is created in.  multiple ssh shell sessions can be created and distinquished by assigning this sessionId to unique flow variables.
flow.name: Create Sudo User

staticBinding.value: sudo useradd ${newUsername}; sudo echo ${newUserPassword} | sudo passwd --stdin ${newUsername}; sudo usermod -G root ${newUsername}

sudo sed -i 's/#PasswordAuthentication .*/PasswordAuthentication yes/' /etc/ssh/sshd_config; sudo sed -i 's/PasswordAuthentication .*/PasswordAuthentication yes/' /etc/ssh/sshd_config; sudo service sshd reload

step.name: Wait for the services to start

staticBinding.value: sudo chmod 600 /etc/sudoers; echo '${newUsername} ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD: ALL' | sudo tee -a /etc/sudoers
